headline.print_headline: Negotiators Meet in Bid To Revive Iran Talks
headline.seo: Nuclear Negotiators Meet in Bid to Revive Iran Talks
headline.main: Negotiators Meet in Bid to Revive Iran Talks

docs.snippet: The top nuclear negotiators for Iran and the big powers held private discussions in Istanbul as part of an effort to restart stalled talks over Iran’s disputed uranium enrichment....
docs.abstract: Top nuclear negotiators for Iran and the big powers hold private discussions in Istanbul as part of an effort to restart stalled talks over Iran’s disputed uranium enrichment.
docs.lead_paragraph: The top nuclear negotiators for Iran and the big powers held private discussions in Istanbul as part of an effort to restart stalled talks over Iran’s disputed uranium enrichment.

headline.print_headline: Syria Orders Schools to Open, but Classes Give Way to War
headline.seo: Syria Orders Schools to Open, but Classes Give Way to War
headline.main: Syria Orders Schools to Open, but Classes Give Way to War

docs.snippet: Instead of projecting calm, the schools reflected what had happened in the rest of the country during the summer: the fighting had grown worse and the routines of daily life more dangerous....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Syria’s Education Ministry ordered schools to open, in an attempt to project calm in the midst of relentless violence; schools, which have experienced everything from enormous drops in student attendance to takeovers by militants, reflect the country's unrest; getting classes back to normal has not been as easy as giving the order to return.

byline.original: By an EMPLOYEE of THE NEW YORK TIMES in SYRIA and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times reported from Damascus, and Kareem Fahim from Baalbek, Lebanon. Hala Droubi contributed reporting from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, and Hania Mourtada and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.

docs.lead_paragraph: Instead of projecting calm, the schools reflected what had happened in the rest of the country during the summer: the fighting had grown worse and the routines of daily life more dangerous.

headline.print_headline: After Libya, Renewed Questions About the Potency of Al Qaeda
headline.seo: Questions About Al Qaeda’s Potency Follow Libya Attack
headline.main: After Libya, Renewed Questions About the Potency of Al Qaeda

docs.snippet: The attack in Benghazi has set off a new debate in Washington and across the Middle East about whether Al Qaeda has been reinvigorated or lives on as a useful boogeyman....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Memo from Washington; attack on the United States mission in Benghazi, Libya, that killed Ambassador J Christopher Stevens has set off a new debate across the Middle East about whether Al Qaeda has been reinvigorated amid the chaos of the Arab Spring or merely lives on through the power of its name, which has become a catch-all for Islamist militants.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Cairo. Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Benghazi, Libya; Hend Hassassi from Tunis; and Steven Lee Myers from Washington.

docs.lead_paragraph: The attack in Benghazi has set off a new debate in Washington and across the Middle East about whether Al Qaeda has been reinvigorated or lives on as a useful boogeyman.

headline.print_headline: Comments Could Vex a Romney Administration
headline.seo: Middle East Comments Could Vex a Romney Administration
headline.main: Middle East Comments Could Vex a Romney Administration

docs.snippet: Mitt Romney’s views on the Middle East and Iran may have already been well known, but comments of his that were captured on video at a fund-raiser could bring difficulties if he wins the presidency....
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney's rejection of a two state solution to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, captured on video at a May fund-raiser, could undermine his effort to bring the two sides together should he become president.

byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Sharon LaFraniere from Boston.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s views on the Middle East and Iran may have already been well known, but comments of his that were captured on video at a fund-raiser could bring difficulties if he wins the presidency.

headline.print_headline: Much of Romney’s View on Taxes Conflicts With Longtime G.O.P. Stand
headline.main: With Tax Comments, Romney Wades Into a Conservative Rift

docs.snippet: Despite conservatives’ goal of reducing the burden on the poor with tax credits, Mitt Romney tapped into an anxiety that “takers” are overtaking “makers.”...
docs.abstract: Mitt Romney, fully supporting comments he made during a May fundraiser, wades into an ideological clash pitting two strands of conservative thinking against each other--the longstanding Republican goal of reducing the tax burden on the poor with tax credits versus the growing anxiety over entitlement programs.

byline.original: By ANNIE LOWREY and MICHAEL COOPER
byline.contributor: Michael Barbaro contributed reporting from Salt Lake City.

docs.lead_paragraph: Despite conservatives’ goal of reducing the burden on the poor with tax credits, Mitt Romney tapped into an anxiety that “takers” are overtaking “makers.”

docs.snippet: Prison officials are under suspicion after the inmates escaped through a tunnel in Piedras Negras....

headline.print_headline: Early Polls Point to Pettitte As Yankees’ Go-To Pitcher
headline.seo: Early Polls Point to Andy Pettitte as Yankees’ Go-to Pitcher
headline.main: Early Polls Point to Pettitte as Yankees’ Go-To Pitcher

docs.snippet: Which starting pitcher would get the call if the Yankees faced a wild-card game and survival?...
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column considers which starting pitcher the New York Yankees will call on if the team faces a wild-card game and survival; suggests team will put its faith in Andy Pettitte, baseball’s career leader in postseason victories.
docs.lead_paragraph: Which starting pitcher would get the call if the Yankees faced a wild-card game and survival?

headline.print_headline: In Race to Bottom, It’s Mets vs. Mets
headline.seo: In Race to Bottom, It’s Mets vs. Mets
headline.main: In Race to Bottom, It’s Mets vs. Mets

docs.snippet: The Mets are on pace to set a record for the lowest home-field winning percentage after the All-Star break. The old mark? It was set by the ’79 Mets....
docs.abstract: New York Mets are on pace to set a new record for the lowest home-field winning percentage after the All-Star break, a record the franchise has held since 1979; other Mets news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mets are on pace to set a record for the lowest home-field winning percentage after the All-Star break. The old mark? It was set by the ’79 Mets.

headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Deny Priest Was Urged to Lie in Abuse Case
headline.seo: D.A.’s Office Denies It Pushed Plea Deal in Abuse Case
headline.main: Prosecutors Deny Priest Was Urged to Lie in Abuse Case

docs.snippet: A motion filed in Philadelphia said that a former clergyman was pressured to falsely admit to abusing a boy as part of the terms of a plea deal....
docs.abstract: Philadelphia district attorney's office challenges a claim by lawyers for convicted Roman Catholic Msgr William J Lynn that prosecutors had persuaded Edward V Avery, another former priest, to falsely admit to sexually abusing a 10-year-old boy in order to obtain the convictions.
docs.lead_paragraph: A motion filed in Philadelphia said that a former clergyman was pressured to falsely admit to abusing a boy as part of the terms of a plea deal.

headline.print_headline: When It Comes to Filmmaking, Yonkers Seeks a Bigger Part
headline.seo: Yonkers Wants Bigger Role in Filmmaking
headline.main: When It Comes to Filmmaking, Yonkers Seeks a Bigger Part

docs.snippet: The city’s mayor, Michael Spano, says he wants to improve Yonkers’s standing as a filmmaking location, and is promoting the use of a local warehouse soundstage....
docs.abstract: Yonkers is promoting the use of Yonkers Stage, a local warehouse soundstage, as part of a serious effort by the city's revived Office of Film and Photography to draw production crews away from New York City.
docs.lead_paragraph: The city’s mayor, Michael Spano, says he wants to improve Yonkers’s standing as a filmmaking location, and is promoting the use of a local warehouse soundstage.
